creator: tansy@pacific.net.sg
text:
Hi,

I'm receiving a "502 Bad Gateway" error whenever I try to access the URL
http://kb.palmone.com/SRVS/CGI-BIN/WEBCGI.EXE?New,Kb=PalmSupportKB,ts=Palm_External2001,Case=obj(35713)
using mod_proxy. Doing away without passing through the proxy works fine on both
Firefox and IE.

When I tried to simulate a HTTP connection, it seems that the IIS is returning
lines that begin with <!-- in the HTTP header.

Is there a possibility of working around this problem?

Cheers.

>telnet kb.palmone.com 80
Trying 66.54.39.99...
Connected to kb.palmone.com.
Escape character is '^]'.
HEAD
/SRVS/CGI-BIN/WEBCGI.EXE?New,Kb=PalmSupportKB,ts=Palm_External2001,Case=obj(35713)
HTTP/1.1
Host: kb.palmone.com

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Microsoft-IIS/5.0
Date: Sat, 27 May 2006 02:10:04 GMT
Connection: close
Content-type: text/html
<!-- case.tem in palm_externa2001 -->
<!-- $Header: f:\cvs/Palm_External2001/Case.tem,v 1.9 2005/05/09 17:25:31
egreenberg Exp $ -->


<html>
...

No, this is a bug in IIS / the application running inside IIS not delivering an
HTTP response that is compliant with RFC2616. mod_proxy cannot be expected to
fix this.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Maybe it can't be expected to fix this, but it does.  See the the ProxyBadHeader
directive.
creator: slive@apache.org
rpluem@apache.org
text:
I was not aware of ProxyBadHeader so far. There is always something left to
learn :-).

Hi Ruediger, Joshua,

Thanks for the responses! ProxyBadHeader did work. I missed it too.

Cheers.
